hackathon-description-text: HackCity (a student-run hackathon at City, University of London) is welcoming students from all over the world for a weekend of hacking, workshops and fun!
hackathon-eligibility: You must have a ticket to attend HackCity18. Any attendees must be 18 or over and be a student with a valid student ID. Teams must have 4 or less people to be eligable for prizes.
hackathon-rules:
You must abide by the MLH code of conduct.
You must not work on a project started before the event.
Teams must have 4 or less people to be eligable for prizes

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Build the best hack that highlights technology and/or business considerations on doing something beneficial for any subset of society

Using Cisco Spark’s Open APIs, come up with a hack that is both innovative and useful. It can be a chat bot or a solution that leverages Cisco Spark as a collaboration platform. To learn more the Spark APIs see

Using your imagination, incorperate the topic of transport. You could make an app, displaying bus routes when you scan the frount of a bus, or using hardware to display tube line information. The outcomes could be endless!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Firstco - Most innovative hack incorperating transportation

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Hook up nexmo to one of the many ‘Bot’ platforms out there, such as Amazon Lex, Microsoft Bot Framework or Google Dialogflow. Get creative, you are free to use any platform you wish.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Nexmo - Best use of Nexmo with a Bot

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The Starling Bank Open Banking APIs give users the power to share and integrate their finacnial data. Build a hack that takes uses the data in new and interesting ways!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Starling Bank - The most innovative use of the Starling Bank API*

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: .tech are offering a prize for the best interactive website using a .tech domain.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-description-header: HackCity18 - City, University of London's hackathon. 24 hours to learn, build and share!
